description_txt: stated on January 16, 2008 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "He reformed welfare before others tried."

description_txt: stated on January 16, 2008 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "And delivered more tax relief than the other Republicans combined."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2008 in a news conference in a Staples store in Columbia, S.C. :
quote_txt: "I don't have lobbyists running my campaign."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in Las Vegas:
quote_txt: "Barack (Obama) has one of his biggest supporters in terms of funding, the Exelon Corporation, which has spent millions of dollars trying to make Yucca Mountain the waste depository."

description_txt: stated on January 16, 2008 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "And he's the only candidate who will fight for a national catastrophe fund to reduce insurance rates."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in a flyer sent to news organizations in South Carolina:
quote_txt: Says McCain was a "Hanoi Hilton songbird" who collaborated with the enemy.

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in a debate in Las Vegas:
quote_txt: Says he passed a bill to stop a military requirement that wounded soldiers pay for meals and phone calls.

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2008 in a speech to the Americans for Prosperity Michigan summit in Livonia, Mich.:
quote_txt: "Congress just passed another huge, pork-filled spending bill. The Democrats allowed less than a day to read all 3,400 pages and stuffed it with nearly 10,000 earmarks costing about $10-billion dollars."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in debate in Las Vegas:
quote_txt: "So that 2005 energy bill was a big step backwards on the path to clean, renewable energy. That's why I voted against it."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in debate in Las Vegas:
quote_txt: "I'm proud of the fact that I've raised more money from small donors than anybody else, and that we're getting $25, $50, $100 donations, and we've done very well doing it that way."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in a debate in Las Vegas.:
quote_txt: "You know, Sen. McCain said the other day that we might have troops (in Iraq) for 100 years..."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2008 in Las Vegas:
quote_txt: "I believe, Senator Clinton, you've raised more money from those people (the oil and gas industry) than any candidate, Democrat or Republican."

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2008 in a debate in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: "The fact is it's not amnesty."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2008 in a debate in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: "I have never asked for nor received a single earmark or pork barrel project for my state."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2008 in a TV interview on CBS.:
quote_txt: "(My dad) used to campaign against the gas-guzzling dinosaurs."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2008 in Dartmouth, N.H.:
quote_txt: Barack Obama "said in 2004 there was no difference between (Obama) and George Bush on the war."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2008 in a debate in Myrtle Beach, S.C.:
quote_txt: "I took on the worst road system in the country, according to Trucker's magazine. When I left, they said it was the most improved road system in the country."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2008 in a debate in Myrtle Beach, S.C.:
quote_txt: "(Ronald Reagan) raised taxes a billion dollars in his first year as governor of California."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2008 in a debate in Myrtle Beach, S.C.:
quote_txt: "I supported (the surge), I argued for it. I'm the only one on this stage that did."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2008:
quote_txt: The church Barack Obama belongs to has a "nonnegotiable commitment to Africa."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2008:
quote_txt: The church Barack Obama belongs to only admits black people.

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2008:
quote_txt: Barack Obama's middle name is Mohammed and he's a "covert" Muslim.

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2008 in a debate in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: "We haven't built a refinery, I think, in 30 years."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2008 in a TV ad airing in Michigan:
quote_txt: Says Time magazine called him "one of America's best governors."

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2008 in a debate in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: "You've got a building in the Cayman Islands that supposedly houses 12,000 corporations. That's either the biggest building or the biggest tax scam on record."

description_txt: stated on December 22, 2007:
quote_txt: The Mormon religion has "a plan that will see the Constitution thrown out and replaced by a theocracy."

description_txt: stated on December 31, 2007 in a campaign event in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "There's not a major bill I know with Hillary's name on it."

description_txt: stated on January 2, 2008 in a mailer from the Romney campaign to Iowans:
quote_txt: "Mike Huckabee raised taxes on dog groomers!"

description_txt: stated on December 31, 2007 in a campaign event in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "Barack Obama hasn't passed any (bills)."

description_txt: stated on December 31, 2007 in a campaign event in Ames, Iowa:
quote_txt: "John doesn't have a record in the Senate. John's only passed four bills. They're all about post offices."
